page.title: 08The Yew Tree,Wilmington
page.content:
In Wilmington church yard there is an impressive Yew tree with a 23 foot girth and two vast trunks. The tree is between 800 and 1000 years old and was probably alive at the time the Domesday Book was written. Its age means that it now has to be supported by chains and old telegraph poles. Despite being old it still bears fruit each year.
Many reasons have been suggested for the presence of the Yew Tree. Some say it discourages animals from wondering in the churchyard while others think it was to stop the growth of weeds around the graves. It is possible that its branches were cut for use as long bows,although we have no proof of this.
